### Title: Carillon Canal Lock Vertical Door Support System Rehabilitation

#### Background

Parks Canada invites tenders for the rehabilitation of the vertical door support system at Carillon Canal Lock National Historic Site. This project involves the design, fabrication, supply, labour, tools, equipment, protection, and transportation required to complete the work.

#### Objective

The contractor will be responsible for:

*   Dry docking of the lock and pumping of water during the entire period of the work, including removal of liquid or solid precipitations (snow or ice).
*   Removal of all dewatering systems upon completion of the work.
*   Re-opening of the lock upon completion of the work.

#### Technical Requirements

*   The contractor must provide heated shelters for the installation of new bearing bars during the winter period.
*   A cofferdam will be installed by the Ministry Representative in the downstream section.
*   The contractor must minimize cofferdam leakage by adding waterproofing membrane or other materials.
*   The contractor is responsible for water management in the lock and work areas.
*   The contractor must plan the partial cleaning of the lock bottom where work is required and the approach, including removal of sludge and other waste materials, and storage, characterization, and disposal of such materials in accordance with current laws.

#### Site Visit

A mandatory site visit will be held on June 29, 2023, at 10:00 AM local time at the parking lot at the bottom of Carillon Lock. The contractor or a representative must attend the meeting and provide the name(s) of the person(s) who will attend. Bidders who do not confirm attendance, provide the names of the attendees, or do not complete and submit the attached certification as required will not be allowed access to the site.

#### Queries and Amendments

All technical and contractual queries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than five (5) business days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time for response. Queries received after this deadline may not receive a response.

#### Tender Requirements

*   The bid must be submitted electronically to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
*   The bid documents must be sent as email attachments.
*   Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.
*   The bid must be accompanied by a valid Certificate of Insurance.
